intro: Waltheria longiramea, commonly known as the long-stemmed waltheria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in Brazil and other parts of South America. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Waltheria longiramea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
